column4: when i do     sudo apt-get install ms-sys i get couldnt find package ms-sys
yea.. so what is that package..?
its the mbr for windows
DOH! yea.. you won't find that in linux
it shows on a site from a old post it works in ubuntu live
what's it suppose to do?
its supposed to reinstall my windows main boot load
http://www.arsgeek.com/2008/01/15/how-to-fix-your-windows-mbr-with-an-ubuntu-livecd/
use your windows disk to do that.  that package is no longer in the repositories that I can find.. are you eliminating ubuntu? or just want the windows bootloader instead of grub?
its oem doesnt come with a disk its partitioned in
so why do you want the windows boot loader?
i turned on my laptop and it gave me that error and my bootloader is gone, i need to reinstall it to use my windows
when you installed ubuntu did you do a dual boot setup?
didnt install ubuntu
so you're just trying to use the live cd to fix your current windows install?
yes

without that file available I'm not sure what you can do other than use the live cd to save off all your data and then use the recovery partition to reinstall windows fresh.. you might ask in ##windows
i can not acces the recovery partition
why? it's usually a hot key combination
do it right and you'll have both to choose from on boot.. it's called a dual boot
it's like having 2 computers .. one windows.. one ubuntu.. you make the choice from the menu when you turn the computer on.. *Don't* install it if windows is running.. boot directly from the cd
